Class Proposition

Represents an unnegated proposition, independent of its value in a given solution.

Syntax
public class Proposition : Literal

Constructors

Proposition()

Make a proposition. Does nothing. This is here only to make it protected so that nobody tries to new their own proposition objects.

Declaration
protected Proposition()

Fields

False

A fixed proposition representing false. This will be recognized by various parts of the compiler and treated accordingly.

Declaration
public static readonly Proposition False
Field Value
Type Description
Proposition

InitialProbability

Probability with which this proposition will be true in the solver's starting guess. Should be a number in the range [0,1].

Declaration

Properties

IsConstant

True if this proposition object is one of the constants true or false. This is different from propositions that are real parts of a Problem, but that have had their values predetermined by axioms, optimization, or the user explicitly setting their values.

Declaration
public bool IsConstant { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

Name

Arbitrary object that functions as the name of this proposition. Distinct Propositions should have distinct Names.

Declaration
public object Name { get; }

RequireHaveSupport()

Force supported model semantics for this proposition. If no rules are provided for it, it will always be false.
